0.text: 10. The Betty and Barney Hill Abduction

10.text:
The abduction of Betty and Barney Hill was
the first abduction ever to be reported in

13.text:
the news in 1961. The Hills were driving in
rural New Hampshire on the night of September

18.text:
19, returning home from a vacation in Niagara
Falls. During this drive, they witnessed bright

23.text:
lights in the night’s sky; Barney pulled
over to get a better look. Using binoculars,

28.text:
the Hills saw an unidentified flying object
in the sky moving towards them. Frightened,

32.text:
they jumped back in their car and drove away
from the light. As they were driving, they

36.text:
noticed that the lights were chasing their
car. And instead of speeding away into the

39.text:
night, Barney decided to pull over again,
this time with his binoculars and a gun. This

44.text:
is when he saw some strange ‘beings’ heading
towards him and his wife.

49.text:
After seeing them, Barney finally hightailed
it out of there, but this was cut short when

53.text:
the Hills heard a strange sound and became
paralyzed by a tingling over their entire

57.text:
body. Thirty-five minutes later the Hills
became aware that something strange had just

61.text:
happened but couldn’t remember what. Barney’s
shoes were all scratched, and both of their

65.text:
watches were mysteriously broken. Barney did
remember driving into a wooded area and meeting

71.text:
six humanoid figures, who used telepathy to
tell them not to be afraid; they were taken

76.text:
onto a ship and tested like lab rats. The
‘aliens’ took samples from the Hills,

80.text:
including skin and semen, maybe to use in
reproduction; we may never know.

88.text:
During the Christmas holiday in 1985, Whitley
Strieber, an author known for The Wolfen in

93.text:
1978 and The Hunger in 1981 was staying with
his family in a cabin in upstate New York.

99.text:
During the night he heard bizarre noises;
he decided to go investigate, and this is

103.text:
when Strieber discovered strange beings in
his bedroom. After seeing these creatures,

107.text:
he woke up, in what seemed only seconds later,
sitting outside in the woods by the cabin.

113.text:
Baffled by what happened and unable to recollect
the events, he hired a hypnotist. After several

119.text:
tries, he was finally able to remember what
happened that night. That night he was levitated

123.text:
out of the room to a ship hovering above the
woods. He recalled there being various creatures

127.text:
on the ship, one that looked like a robot,
and some were skinny with dark eyes. This

132.text:
is when he also remembered the procedures
that were performed on him. The creatures

135.text:
put a long needle into his brain and anally
probed him. Although many thought him to be

139.text:
hallucinating these events, he swears to this
day that these events were, in fact, real.

149.text:
In Michigan in 2012, trucker Scott Murray
received an alarming call from his wife. She

154.text:
explained that she thought that she might
have been knocked out and possibly raped.

157.text:
Murray rushed home and took his wife to the
hospital. The doctors and nurses said that

161.text:
they found no indication that she was raped
but did find a burn on her shoulder. This

165.text:
was when Murray wrapped up the incident as
just a nightmare that his wife had. That was

170.text:
until, the next day, when he went outside
of his home and found weird disk shaped burns

174.text: in the grass by their garden.

176.text:
After further investigation, he found a tree
twenty feet away with burnt leaves on it.

180.text:
This was when he knew something strange had
happened there the night before. After the

184.text:
discovery, Murray took his wife to see a hypnotic
regression specialist; this is where she remembered

189.text:
being on a spacecraft and began to recall
the tests that were performed on her. This

193.text:
cause Murray’s wife to become paranoid and
frightened; Murray later found his wife dead

197.text:
after returning from a trip. Wanting answers,
Murray took samples of the grass to the local

202.text:
college, who told him that it was just radiation
burns. To this day Scott Murray does not know

207.text: the truth about his wife’s death.

212.text:
In 1957, twenty-three-year old Brazilian farmer
Antonio Vilas-Boas was working late in the

219.text:
field. While working in the fields, he noticed
a red light in the night sky; this light started

224.text:
to move towards him and grew larger. This
was when he noticed that the light was an

228.text:
oval shaped, and the top part of it was spinning.
That is when the UFO landed in the field;

233.text:
Boas jumped on his tractor to escape but it
stopped working shortly after he turned it

237.text:
on, so he began to run. That was when one
of the aliens, dressed in a helmet and coveralls,

242.text:
grabbed him. Three others came to help the
alien put Boas into their ship; they were

246.text:
also dressed in coveralls and had creepy blue
eyes.

249.text:
After entering the ship, he was stripped of
his clothes and covered in a type of gel.

253.text:
The creatures took blood samples and then
a female creature appeared and began to have

257.text:
sexual intercourse with him. After she was
finished, she patted his stomach and pointed

261.text:
into the air as if to tell him that she would
have his baby in space. When Boas was being

266.text:
released from the ship he tried to take something
off the ship as proof of his abduction but

270.text:
was then thrown off. He went on to become
a lawyer and still swears that his story is

278.text:
In 1969, at Buff Ledge summer camp in Vermont,
two teenage employees, known as Michael and

282.text:
Janet in the reports, were sitting on the
dock enjoying the sunset one late afternoon,

287.text:
when a bright light filled the sky. They watched
the light as it drew closer to them. As they

291.text:
watched, three smaller lights broke off from
the big light and began to dart over the lake.

295.text:
One of the little lights fell into the water;
a few minutes went by then the light shot

300.text: up and started flying towards them.

302.text:
As the light began to get closer Michael yelled
at the light and suddenly they were floating.

307.text:
Seconds later, the two were back on the dock
and the lights were gone. Neither talked about

310.text:
what had happened. Over the years, Michael
became obsessed with finding out what happened

314.text:
to him. He went to a hypnotist who helped
him remember. This is where he recalled the

318.text:
ship and having samples being taken from him.
He remembered the aliens had large eyes and

323.text:
three fingers on each hand that were webbed.
After remembering all that had happen to him,

327.text:
Michael contacted Janet and she described
the same story as Michael.

335.text:
In Maine in 1976, artists Jack and Jim Weiner,
along with friends Charlie Foltz and Chuck

340.text:
Rak where doing some night fishing when the
men noticed bright objects flying in the sky.

345.text:
One of the lights started to move towards
the canoe. Frightened by this sight, the men

349.text:
started to hastily paddle back to the shore.
Before the men could reach it, a beam of light

355.text:
The men woke up later sitting on the shore
by the fire, which was almost completely out.

359.text:
When the men got home, they experienced nightmares
of being poked and prodded by the aliens.

364.text:
All four men went under hypnosis to remember
the events; this is where they remembered

367.text:
being tested and having bodily fluids removed
from them. Even though the men got separate

372.text:
sessions, all of their stories were exactly
the same. Since the men were artists, they

376.text:
were able to sketch the room, aliens, and
tools used on them from their memories.

385.text:
In 1975, in the Alamogordo desert in New Mexico,
the site of the recent recovery of the lost

390.text:
Atari video game burial, where all the lost
E.T. games and consoles were found, Sergeant

395.text:
Moody was watching a meteor shower, when he
saw a spherical metal object in the sky, hovering

400.text:
only a few hundred meters away from him. The
object began to come towards him, so he began

404.text:
to run to his car. Once in the car, it wouldn’t
start; when he looked at the object again

408.text:
he could see that there were human shapes
in the window of it watching him. Then he

412.text:
heard a loud high-pitched sound and felt paralyzed
as he watched it fly away.

417.text:
Moody was able to get his car started and
went home but was astonished that is was three

421.text:
in the morning, meaning that he had an hour
and a half of time unaccounted for. Days after

425.text:
the incident Moody broke out in a rash and
experienced back pain. Using self-hypnosis

430.text:
Moody was able to fill in the gaps of time
that he lost. He remembered two tall creatures

434.text:
approach him after becoming numb. He recalled
trying to fight them but blacked out. That

439.text:
is when he woke in the craft on a table, telepathically
being asked by one of the creatures if he

444.text:
would consent to behave and he agreed. The
creatures gave him a tour of the craft and

448.text: told him that they would return in two decades.

453.text:
In 1989 in New York, Linda Napolitano was
abducted from her apartment. This abduction

459.text:
had multiple eyewitness accounts. On November
30 around three in the morning, Napolitano

463.text:
was abducted; she had no idea what happened
after the abduction but through hypnosis she

468.text:
was able to put the pieces together. She soon
remembered that three grey aliens levitated

473.text: her out her window to a ship.

475.text:
Two bodyguards of United Nations statesman
Javier Perez de Cuellar witnessed this abduction.

480.text:
Jent Kimball also witnessed this but chalked
it up to a movie being filmed in the area.

484.text:
Napolitano hired UFO researcher Budd Hopkins
to investigate but couldn’t get Cuellar

489.text:
to tell the public about what happened that
night. This is one of the only UFO abductions

493.text:
to be witnessed by so many people but never
fully investigated.

500.text:
What if the Men In Black are real and are
out there to protect the secrets of the galaxy?

504.text:
Dr. Herbert Hopkins found out the hard way
that this just might be the truth. Although

508.text:
Hopkins was not abducted, he did have a run
in with a strange person that didn’t want

512.text:
him investigating an abduction. In 1976, Hopkins
was hired to consult on a case in Maine as

517.text:
a doctor and hypnotist. While alone at his
home one evening he got a call from a man

522.text:
in the New Jersey UFO Research Organization,
informing him that he wanted to talk to him

526.text:
about the case. Hopkins agreed and went outside
to turn on the light so the man could find

530.text:
his house but before he could even step outside,
there was a man walking up his porch stairs.

535.text:
He was dressed in a black suit and hat, once
he removed the hat he say the man was completely

540.text:
His skin was almost transparent until Hopkins
noticed that the man was wearing lipstick.

544.text:
The man entered the house and they discussed
the case but something occurred that scared

548.text:
Hopkins as they were talking. The man showed
him a coin and made it disappear then told

553.text:
Hopkins, “Neither you, nor anyone else on
this planet will ever see that coin again.”

558.text:
This terrified Hopkins, so as the man requested,
he got rid of all the tapes of the hypnotic

562.text:
sessions and stopped working on the case.
After some research, he discovered there was

566.text:
not a New Jersey UFO Research Organization.
Spooky.

573.text:
In 1973, Peter Khoury moved to Australia and
he met his beautiful wife Vivian. In February

580.text:
of 1988, strange things began to occur: the
couple started to see weird lights in the

585.text:
sky but it wasn’t until that summer in July
that Peter had his first terrifying experience.

590.text:
Peter was lying in his bed when he felt a
jolt on his ankle. This caused Peter to become

595.text:
paralyzed but conscious, which is when he
realized there were four hooded silhouettes

599.text:
standing next to his bed. They told him telepathically
that it would be over fast, and then raised

604.text:
a long needle to his head, and then he blacked
out. His next encounter didn’t come until

609.text:
1992; Peter woke up in his bed to find two
naked female creatures sitting on his bed.

614.text:
They looked human in almost every aspect but
their eyes were twice the size of humans.

619.text:
The one with blonde hair grabbed him and pushed
his face into her chest. The female was strong

623.text:
and Peter tried to escape her grasp. When
he finally caught his breath from the struggle,

627.text:
they were gone. This is when he found two
blonde hairs wrapped around his genitals.

632.text:
He removed them and put them in a bag for
further research. The hairs were examined

635.text:
by scientists, who determined them to appear
human but had five different DNA markers,

640.text:
which is associated with Mongolians. Although
nothing has been found since then, the Physical

644.text:
Evidence Group is still looking for answers
about the strange female humanoid
